thread.title: Oregon State men's basketball ranks 43rd in Ken Pomeroy preseason projections: Beavers rundown
thread.title_full: Oregon State men's basketball ranks 43rd in Ken Pomeroy preseason projections: Beavers rundown | OregonLive.com

author: Danny Moran | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon State men's basketball ranks 43rd in Ken Pomeroy preseason projections: Beavers rundown
text:
It has been an offseason of media optimism for Oregon State men's basketball.
Following a quicker than expected turnaround in Wayne Tinkle's first year in Corvallis, the Beavers will return over 90 percent of their scoring, Pac-12 Defensive Player of the Year Gary Payton II and and add a stellar freshman class .
Oregon State was picked to finish sixth in the conference at Pac-12 Media Day, Yahoo's Jeff Eisenberg named the Beavers one of eight programs on the rise and ESPN "bracketologist" Joe Lunardi had the team as one of his last four into his first projected NCAA Tournament .
One of the latest bits of preseason praise comes from the advanced analytic site KenPom.com , which projected Oregon State 43 rd out of 351 teams in the country. The site calculates its ratings through advanced statistics such offensive efficiency, defensive efficiency and tempo in order to predict success.
If that preseason ranking holds true, it would be Oregon State's highest since the site began operating for the 2001-2002 season.
Despite a season that in the eyes of many rejuvenated the program, the Beavers finished 117 th in the site's rankings last year largely due to the team's offensive struggles. However, Oregon State also ranked 16 th in adjusted defensive efficiency.
Here is a look at how Oregon State has finished in the ratings each year dating back to 2002, along with the team's corresponding records.
2015: 117 th , 17-14 (8-10, 7 th in the Pac-12)
2014: 110 th , 16-16 (8-10, 10 th )
2013: 94 th , 14-18 (4-14, T-11 th )
2012: 102 nd , 21-15 (7-11, T-8 th )
2011: 162 nd , 11-20 (5-13, 9 th in the Pac-10)
2010: 165 th , 14-18 (8-10, 7 th )
2009: 97 th , 18-18 (8-11, 8 th )
2008: 264 th , 6-25 (0-18, 10 th )
2007: 162 nd , 11-21 (3-15, 9 th )
2006: 143 rd , 13-18 (5-13, 8 th )
2005: 109 th , 17-15 (8-10, 5 th )
2004: 145 th , 12-16 (6-12, 9 th )
2003: 129 th , 13-15 (6-12, 6 th )
2002: 129 th , 11-17 (4-14, 9 th )
The Beavers will host an open scrimmage at Gill Coliseum on Wednesday at 6 p.m. Attendance to the scrimmage is free.
